message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.SD, cs.DB. 

The paper deals with the problem of topic identification in microblog posts, which is a common task in information retrieval (cs.IR) and natural language processing (cs.CL). The proposed approach utilizes Linked Open Data (LOD) resources, which are commonly used in semantic web (cs.SI) and knowledge representation (cs.AI). The approach also involves entity linking, which is a technique used in information extraction (cs.IR, cs.CL) and natural language understanding (cs.AI). The co-occurrence graphs used in the approach can be seen as a form of network analysis (cs.SI, cs.SD), while the ontology introduced for representing topics can be seen as a form of database modeling (cs.DB).
